alert.note: Alert for Jackson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 27 at 8:15PM CST until January 29 at 1:10AM CST by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... Trinity River at Riverside affecting Walker, Polk, Trinity and San Jacinto Counties. San Jacinto River near Sheldon affecting Harris County. Brazos River near West Columbia affecting Brazoria County. Trinity River near Moss Bluff affecting Chambers and Liberty Counties. Trinity River at Liberty affecting Liberty County. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas... San Bernard River Near East Bernard affecting Wharton, Austin, Fort Bend and Colorado Counties. San Bernard River near Boling affecting Wharton, Brazoria and Fort Bend Counties. Navidad River at Strane Park affecting Jackson County. Lavaca River near Edna affecting Jackson County. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Texas... Menard Creek near Rye affecting Hardin, Polk and Liberty Counties. Colorado River at Wharton affecting Wharton and Matagorda Counties. For the Trinity River...including Crockett, Riverside, Romayor, Goodrich, Liberty, Moss Bluff...Major flooding is forecast. For the West Fork San Jacinto River...including Porter, Sendera Ranch Road, Conroe, Humble, Sheldon...Major flooding is forecast. For the Brazos River...including Bryan, West Columbia, US 59, Sugar Land, TX, Hempstead, Bellville, San Felipe, Richmond, Rosharon... Moderate flooding is forecast. For the San Bernard River...including East Bernard, Sweeny, Boling... Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Navidad River...including Sublime, Speaks, Morales, Strane Park...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Lavaca River...including Komensky, Breslau, Hallettsville, Edna...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Navidad River at Strane Park. * WHEN...Until early Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 29.0 feet, Major lowland flooding begins with the river close to one third of a miles wide in the vicinity of the gage. County Road 401 is inundated and closed and the lowest homes in the flood plain are threatened. Livestock can be cut off in low lying parts of the flood plain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 PM CST Saturday the stage was 27.6 feet. - Bankfull stage is 13.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:15 PM CST Saturday was 28.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early tomorrow afternoon and continue falling to 9.2 feet Thursday evening. - Flood stage is 24.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 27.7 feet on 04/21/2016. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (6 pm CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sun Mon Tue Navidad River Strane Park 24.0 27.6 Sat 7 pm CST 19.9 11.4 10.1 &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 915 PM CST.
